org.sm.smtools.swing.util

Class JTriggeredButton

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.AbstractButton
            • javax.swing.JButton
              • org.sm.smtools.swing.util.JTriggeredButton
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.ItemSelectable, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.SwingConstants
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    JUnfocusableTriggeredButton

    public class JTriggeredButton
extends javax.swing.JButton
    The JTriggeredButton class provides a button that automatically hides/shows its border.

    Initially, a JTriggeredButton has no border drawn, but when the mouse pointer hovers above its location, its border becomes activated.

    Version:
    22/01/2004
    Author:
    Sven Maerivoet
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        public final java.awt.Color getBackground()
